svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2020-03-24T08:41:37.546Z" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/80.0.3987.122 Safari/537.36" etag="snh9BOOGttmVZs0Zxpfe" version="12.8.6" type="google" pages="2"><diagram name="WoT new lifecycle" id="WoT_new_lifecycle"></diagram><diagram name="Page-1" id="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 138px; height: 1px; padding-top: 151px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

font.style: font-family: "calibri" ; color: rgb(255 , 255 , 255) ; direction: ltr ; letter-spacing: 0px ; line-height: 120% ; opacity: 1
font-size: 14px

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 138px; height: 1px; padding-top: 261px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

font.style: font-size: 12px ; font-family: "calibri" ; color: #73ae42 ; direction: ltr ; letter-spacing: 0px ; line-height: 120% ; opacity: 1

div.font:
Data
Factory defaults
Or: Device has been fully decommissioned: User data must be wiped out
Optional data:

font.style: font-size: 12px ; font-family: "themed" ; color: #73ae42 ; direction: ltr ; letter-spacing: 0px ; line-height: 120% ; opacity: 1

div.font:
device-specific identity,
certificates, key pair
No user data

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 178px; height: 1px; padding-top: 166px; margin-left: 243px;

div.font:
identity is established,
device owner is defined,
trust chain (certs) set.
Device+Consumer relationship has been established?

div.font:
WoT operation configuration
WoT security configuration
(ACLs, all required keys and certs, etc.)
WoT userdata
(will be collected in this state)

State Description:
Device can never be used again

div.font:
All the data from the operational
only state can be changed in this state
(not the data from bootstraped state!)

Provision WoT operational configuration,
WoT security configuration
Register Device with consumers and/or directories
Provision a device with a service

div.div:
Who are the actors?
Consider putting names in the description

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 278px; height: 1px; padding-top: 570px; margin-left: 391px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Need names for all state transitions, perhaps only an abbreviation and a full legend in a table

switch.text: Need names for all state transitions, perhaps...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 278px; height: 1px; padding-top: 710px; margin-left: 391px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Consider creating a table that is a matrix between actors and state transitions. This would illustrate who is permitted/usually doing a state transition

switch.text: Consider creating a table that is a matrix bet...

div.div: •Network Provider (potentially transparent for WoT use cases)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 308px; height: 1px; padding-top: 570px; margin-left: 692px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
ZK> Or have short names for states, like F, B, O, M, D
and transitions like FB, BO, OM, OD, OF, OB, etc.,
or special names if there are multiple causes for transition
Note: F is for Factory or manuFactured

switch.text: ZK> Or have short names for states, like F, B, O, M...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 308px; height: 1px; padding-top: 685px; margin-left: 692px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: ZK> Operational might have many sub-states, just as Bootstrapped. Maintenance state could be part of Operational, since many devices can do background maintenance, initiated by user or automatically or remotely. (Re)configuration is also a sub-state since the device can be continuously operating also under (re)configuration. Soft reset (config reset) can also be a sub-state of Operational. From lifecycle POV, all can be seen as Operational state.

switch.text: ZK> Operational might have many sub-states, just as...

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
